description: This module allows Economics/Mathematics or Applied Mathematics double degree students to write an honours thesis that integrates their two areas of study — Economics and Mathematics/Applied Mathematics. Students taking this module must conduct an independent research project and write a scholarly report of not more than 40 typed pages (including bibliography and appendices) on a rigorous multi‐disciplinary research on an approved topic under the supervision of two faculty members (one from Economics and one from the Department of Mathematics).
title: Integrated Honours Thesis
